Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.profiler

Class Profiler

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.profiler.Profiler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Profiler extends Object implements Serializable
A basic profiler that samples code from a single thread and accumulates the samples in a map for merger with other profilers or for output as a formatted string. This object accumulates samples of the program stack of its assigned thread at time intervals set by the client at construction. The samples include the class name, method name, and line number of the program at which each sample is taken. The samples are recorded for each member of the stack trace of the current sample. The actual content of the samples are stored in a separate object (a ProfilerContent object) to remove the content from the control so that it can be returned compactly to a caller in a distributed or concurrent parallel operation.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Jim Hipp

  • Constructor Details

    • Profiler

      public Profiler(Thread thrd, long period, String name)
      Standard Constructor. Creates a new profiler assigning the name, thread, and sample period.
      Parameters:
      thrd - The thread from which profiler will record samples.
      period - The time (in milliseconds) between each consecutive sample. Note: If period is too small then the program may spend all of its time in the sampler and no time in the actual program.
      name - The user assigned name of this profiler.

  • Method Details

    • getProfilerSampleTaskThread

      public Thread getProfilerSampleTaskThread()
      Returns the ProfilerSampleTaskThread of this Profiler so that it can be profiled. There is never any other reason to call this function.
      Returns:
      The ProfilerSampleTaskThread of this Profiler so that it can be profiled.

    • outputOnSampleCount

      public void outputOnSampleCount(int outsmplecnt, boolean repeat)
      Sets the content output and repeat flag based on the current sample count. If repeat is true then the content is dumped to standard output after each passing of outsmplecnt samples. If repeat is false then output is dumped only once.
      Parameters:
      outsmplecnt - The number of samples after which output will be sent to the standard output device.
      repeat - Repeat flag. If true output is sent after each consecutive set of outsmplecnt samples are reached.

    • outputOnTimer

      public void outputOnTimer(long period, boolean repeat)
      Sets the content output timer period and repeat flag. If repeat is true then the content is dumped to standard output after each the passing of each output period. If repeat is false then output is dumped only once.
      Parameters:
      period - The period of time (milliseconds) after which output will be sent to the standard output device.
      repeat - Repeat flag. If true output is sent after each consecutive "period".

    • setTopClass

      public void setTopClass(String topClass)
      Sets the top class, above which, no other classes are recored in any sample operations by this profiler. In other words, no classes above this class in a sample call stack are recorded in the profiler content.
      Parameters:
      topClass - The new top class definition.

    • setTopMethod

      public void setTopMethod(String topMethod)
      Sets the top method, above which, no other methods are recorded in any sample operations by this profiler. In other words, no methods above this method in a sample call stack are recorded in the profiler content.
      Parameters:
      topMethod - The new top method definition.

    • accumulateOn

      public void accumulateOn()
      Turn on accumulation. Used by the client to control where in a program sample accumulation occurs.

    • accumulateOff

      public void accumulateOff()
      Turn off accumulation. Used by the client to control where in a program sample accumulation occurs.

    • getAccumulationTime

      public String getAccumulationTime()
      Returns the total sample accumulation time as a formatted string.
      Returns:
      The total sample accumulation time as a formatted string.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops this profiler from accumulating any more samples.

    • getAccumulationString

      public String getAccumulationString(String prepnd)
      Build and return profiler content as a formatted string. Each line is prepended with prepnd.
      Parameters:
      prepnd - Buffer string prepended to each line.
      Returns:
      The formatted profiler content string.

      Add the input profilers content to this one.
      Parameters:
